DOC.detailed_description: Traditional informed consent document tend lengthy technical , often dense facilitate proper patient-engagement . In study , investigator test effectiveness previously develop patient-centered , short inform consent document patient-centered , short inform animated consent video compare lengthy traditional informed consent document clinical condition ( i.e . severe asthma ) In study , self-identified asthma patient , age 18 old , attend experimental session university computer laboratory randomly assign read either full informed consent document ( control ) short , patient-centered informed consent document view short patient-centered informed consent video . Participants also complete follow-up survey 1-week . The main outcome measure : Engagement information ( 1=not engage , 2=not engage , 3= somewhat engage , 4=very engage , 5=completely engage ) . Intention enroll clinical trial ( 1=definitely would , 3=neutral , 5=definitely would ) Trial knowledge ( 12 multiple choice question , e.g . `` `` When [ participant ] withdraw trial ? '' ) Trust clinical trial physician ( Six question begin , `` If [ participant ] decide enroll study , much would [ participant ] trust Dr. Janet Taylor , physician lead study , ... '' ) Perceived risk benefit trial ( Four question , e.g . `` Imagine [ participant ] enrol clinical trial , likely [ participant ] think drug would effective treat [ participant 's ] asthma symptom average asthma drug market ? '' ) The investigator hypothesize two experimental condition outperform control condition engagement trial knowledge would well control remain outcome measure .
